sen.j: 公庄駅（ぐじょうえき）は、京都府福知山市大江町 (京都府)公庄にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道(KTR)北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Gujo Station is a railroad station on the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR) Miyafuku Line located in Gujo, Oe-cho, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Gujo Station is a railroad facility on the Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR) Miyafuku Line located in Gujo, Oe-cho, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Gujo Station, located in Gujo, Oe-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railroad facility of the Miyafuku Line, which is operated by Kitakinki Tango Railway (KTR).
sen.cmt: 表現を統一しました。京都府 を追加しました。

sen.e: Structure of the station
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 西側に片面1面1線のプラットホームを持つ無人駅である。
sen.e: Gujo Station is an unmanned station that has a platform with a single railroad track.
Gujo Station is an unmanned facility with a platform and a single railroad track.
Gujo Station is an unmanned facility with a platform and a single railroad track on the west side.

sen.j: 駅舎は盛土上のホームから下りた所にあり、小規模の駅前広場を持つ。
sen.e: There is a small square in front of the station office, which is located on the ground level lower than the platform built on a mound.
There is a small square in front of the station office; it's located on the ground level, which is lower than the platform, which is built on a mound.
There is a small square in front of the station office; it's located on the ground level, which is lower than the platform, which is built on a mound.
Areas around the station
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 駅前から少し西を国道175号が走る。
sen.e: Route 175 runs a little west of the station.
Route 175 runs slightly west of the station.
National Route 175 runs slightly west of the station.
sen.cmt: 国道→national route としました。

sen.j: 駅からやや東を由良川が流れる。
sen.e: The Yura-gawa River flows a little east of the station.
The Yura-gawa River flows east of the station.
The Yura-gawa River flows east of the station.

sen.j: 公庄簡易郵便局 南西100m
sen.e: Gujo branch post office, 100 meters southwest
The Gujo branch post office, 100 meters southwest
The Gujo branch post office, 100 meters southwest

sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約22人である。
sen.e: The number of daily passengers using the station was about 22 in 2006.
The number of daily passengers using the station was about 22 in 2006.
The number of daily passengers using the station was about 22 in fiscal year 2006.
sen.cmt: fiscal year を追加しました。

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）7月16日：宮福鉄道（現・北近畿タンゴ鉄道）宮福線の駅として開業。
sen.e: Gujo Station opened as a station on the Miyafuku Railway (currently, the Kitakinki Tango Railway) Miyafuku Line on July 16, 1988.
Gujo Station opened as a facility on the Miyafuku Railway (currently the Kitakinki Tango Railway) Miyafuku Line on July 16, 1988.
July 16, 1988: Gujo Station opened as a facility on the Miyafuku Railway (currently the Kitakinki Tango Railway) Miyafuku Line.

sen.j: 1970年代まで、宮福線駅の西側に北丹鉄道の公庄駅があった（1971年休止、1974年廃止）。
sen.e: Until the 1970s, there was Hokutan Railway Gujo Station on the west of the Miyafuku Line Gujo Station (the Hokutan Railway station was closed in 1971 and abolished in 1974).
Until the 1970s, there was Hokutan Railway Gujo Station on the west of the Miyafuku Line's Gujo Station (the Hokutan Railway station was closed in 1971 and abolished in 1974).
Until the 1970s, there was Hokutan Railway Gujo Station on the west of the Miyafuku Line's Gujo Station (the Hokutan Railway station was closed in 1971 and abolished in 1974).
